content:
Indeed, single crystals with suitable sizes for SCXRD analysis were obtained by the synthetic condition of combining L1 and Zn­(NO3)2·6H2O in 1,2-dichlorobenzene and N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF) at 120 °C for 2 days. The SCXRD study showed NU-650 crystallizes in a monoclinic space group, C2/m, with lattice parameters of a = 37.343(1), b = 33.0826(8), c = 24.9833(5), and β = 90.696(2)° at 220 K. NU-650 is formulated by SCXRD analysis as Zn4O­(L1)3[Zn­(OH)2(H2O)2(DMF)2]0.5. Each deprotonated dicarboxylate ligand of L1 is coordinated to two Zn4O inorganic clusters, and each Zn4O is coordinated to six deprotonated dicarboxylates. Additionally, we observed twofold interpenetrated networks in NU-650, which is a common phenomenon for IRMOFs made from dicarboxylate ligands with long sizes. Interestingly, two near-Zn4O nodes from different networks are bridged by O–Zn–O moieties with two water and two DMF molecules coordinated to Zn sites in the equatorial position. Such connection between the two catenated networks is reminiscent of Sauvage catenates, from which the removal of the connection results in the synthesis of the catenanes.

In order to regulate the catenation of this MOF platform, we opted to modify the clathrochelate-based ligands by introducing n-butyl groups to the cores of the linkers. Cubic single crystals were obtained under the synthetic condition of using L2 and Zn­(NO3)2·6H2O in mixed solvents of 1,2-dichlorobenzene and DMF at 120 °C, which is very similar to that of NU-650. The SCXRD analysis of NU-651 revealed that it crystallizes in a cubic space group, Pm3̅m, with lattice parameters of a = 24.9082(7) at 250 K (). It is formulated as Zn4O­(L2)3 by SCXRD study. Each Zn4O node is coordinated to six ligands, and each ligand is coordinated to two Zn4O node, resulting in the overall 3-periodic framework based on the pcu net.
clean_text:
Indeed, single crystals with suitable sizes for SCXRD analysis were obtained by the synthetic condition of combining L1 and Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O in 1,2-dichlorobenzene and N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF) at 120 °C for 2 days. The SCXRD study showed NU-650 crystallizes in a monoclinic space group, C2/m, with lattice parameters of a = 37.343(1), b = 33.0826(8), c = 24.9833(5), and β = 90.696(2)° at 220 K. NU-650 is formulated by SCXRD analysis as Zn4O(L1)3[Zn(OH)2(H2O)2(DMF)2]0.5. Each deprotonated dicarboxylate ligand of L1 is coordinated to two Zn4O inorganic clusters, and each Zn4O is coordinated to six deprotonated dicarboxylates. Additionally, we observed twofold interpenetrated networks in NU-650, which is a common phenomenon for IRMOFs made from dicarboxylate ligands with long sizes. Interestingly, two near-Zn4O nodes from different networks are bridged by O-Zn-O moieties with two water and two DMF molecules coordinated to Zn sites in the equatorial position. Such connection between the two catenated networks is reminiscent of Sauvage catenates, from which the removal of the connection results in the synthesis of the catenanes. 

In order to regulate the catenation of this MOF platform, we opted to modify the clathrochelate-based ligands by introducing n-butyl groups to the cores of the linkers. Cubic single crystals were obtained under the synthetic condition of using L2 and Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O in mixed solvents of 1,2-dichlorobenzene and DMF at 120 °C, which is very similar to that of NU-650. The SCXRD analysis of NU-651 revealed that it crystallizes in a cubic space group, Pm3̅m, with lattice parameters of a = 24.9082(7) at 250 K (). It is formulated as Zn4O(L2)3 by SCXRD study. Each Zn4O node is coordinated to six ligands, and each ligand is coordinated to two Zn4O node, resulting in the overall 3-periodic framework based on the pcu net.

other properties: Formulated as Zn4O(L2)3 based on the pcu net
